title: Arkansas man robbed at gunpoint while delivering pizza in Little Rock, police say
title_page: Arkansas man robbed at gunpoint while delivering pizza in Little Rock, police say
text:
A robber wearing a black ski mask stole cash from a pizza delivery man at gunpoint Monday in Little Rock, authorities said.
The 20-year-old victim told police he was delivering a pizza to a home in the 2900 block of South Scott Street at 9 p.m. when a black male wearing a ski mask and black hoodie jumped out of the bushes.
The assailant then pulled out a gun and said, "All I want is the money," according to a Little Rock Police Department report.
The Pizza Hut employee gave him $14 and then drove away. Officers wrote that the robber kept his gun pointed at the car as it left the area.
When the victim got back to the restaurant, he told police that he called the number on the order. The man who answered sounded like he could have been the gunman, the report states.
The robber is described as standing 5 feet, 11 inches and weighing 160 pounds.
No suspect was named, and no arrest had been made at the time of the report.
